content.description: Start on the right side of boulder when facing the west face. Look for huge chalked horizontal horn. Start here sitting and work out left on obvious chalked crimps. Dropping slightly down on crimps in the middle of the face. After this start to work up and hit the nice sculpted crimp. From here transition right hand to the arête and finish the last 2-3 moves of NW Arete.

This route starts on good holds and works slightly right of he center and then slightly traverse into the center of face and up using the great holds. Fun moves on big holds with a exciting mantle on top. Classic!
content.location: Start a little to the right of the center of the face and work to the left and up using good holds.

content.description: Difficult starting moves lead to enjoyable, easy climbing.
content.location: Sit-start on the obvious large crimps a few feet right of the NW arête.  Make a big move out right and then continue straight up on generally large holds.

content.description: Beautiful smooth arête almost dyke like. Good body movement and a little bit of lay backing get you off the ground. Work the dyked arête to the top about 5 ft from the top to a tricky mantle.As you go higher it gets tricky. Great Problem! Has to be in the top 3 arête boulder problems in The Hills.
content.location: NW arête tall beautiful and obvious when looking at the boulder.

content.description:
Start crouching on some awkward crimps, work you way up into the protruding block above your head, get whatever feet you can then aim and fire for the holds on top.

 Submitter's Dialog: * Not sure who the FA was... * Mike mentioned a problem around the corner from NW Arete (of which I think should get a better name, but will probably stay for historical reasons), I think this is it. * If this already has a name, feel free to make a suggestion and I'll make the change. I just figured I'd throw a name on it since it's known of but not on MP.
content.location: The North face of the boulder. Around the corner of "NW Arête ". Start crimps are the only available.

content.description: Boulder with classic routes. Good landings this boulder is rut next to The scenic Boulder. Bo Fuks has a classic line up the middle with fun movement and a good mantle on top. Climbed in his tennie shoes hence the name.  There is also an amazing arête on the northwest corner.
